discourse_list.title: [Proposal - Akita] Limit AKITA related proposals to allow new ideas to be proposed

content.content: Hi, I’m a new user of Gitcoin and I been noticing that most of the proposals are AKITA related. I think that this formation of proposals are blocking other non-related ideas to be evaluated. It almost seems like the AKITA community is trying to take control of the platform and I don’t think its fair. I’m a Binance Smart Chain enthusiast and I’m not really sure if I’m allowed to make more than one proposal related to BSC but for the sake of the Gitcoin community I limited my proposal related to BSC to just one which I think the AKITA community should also abide to  .
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is proposing to limit AKITA related proposals on Gitcoin to allow for other non-related ideas to be evaluated. The post explains the author's perspective and suggests that the AKITA community should limit their proposals to one, similar to the author's proposal related to Binance Smart Chain. The post also invites feedback and constructive criticism on the proposal and raises questions about the fairness of the current proposal formation.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: Yeah I agree there needs to be some kind of moderation, maybe an AKITA exclusive channel and the rest of AKITA posts should be filtered out.
Please check the pinned post in this thread, also found here Snapshot This is the all inclusive proposal put forth by the community
